skill.name: competitive-ads-extractor
skill.description: Extracts and analyzes competitors' ads from ad libraries (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) to understand what messaging, problems, and creative approaches are working. Helps inspire and improve your own ad campaigns.

skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. The skill defines how an AI assistant should analyze competitor ads but cannot take any actions itself - it relies on the AI tool having appropriate MCP tools available.

content.user_title: Extract competitor ads for marketing insights
content.value_statement: Competitor ad research requires manual browsing of multiple ad libraries. This skill automates the extraction and analysis process, identifying successful messaging patterns, pain points being targeted, and creative approaches that resonate with audiences.
actual_capabilities: Extract active ads from Facebook Ad Library for any competitor
Scrape and analyze LinkedIn ads for B2B positioning
Identify pain points and problems highlighted in ad copy
Categorize ads by theme, audience segment, and format type
Discover successful creative patterns and visual approaches
Compare messaging strategies across multiple competitors
limitations: Only works with platforms that have public ad libraries (Facebook, LinkedIn)
Cannot access private ad accounts or restricted data
Analysis quality depends on available ad library data and transparency
Does not provide engagement metrics or performance data

use_cases.title: Plan effective ad campaigns
use_cases.description: Research competitor messaging to discover proven angles and avoid repeating unsuccessful approaches in your campaigns.

use_cases.title: Find positioning opportunities
use_cases.description: Identify gaps in competitor messaging to position your product against underserved pain points and audiences.

use_cases.title: Discover winning creative patterns
use_cases.description: Analyze ad creative and copy formulas that work across competitors to inspire high-performing test variations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic ad extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all current ads from [Competitor Name] on Facebook Ad Library. What messaging, problems, and creative approaches are they using?

prompt_templates.title: Multi-competitor analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract ads from these competitors: [Company A], [Company B], [Company C]. Compare their messaging strategies and identify common patterns that work across all of them.

prompt_templates.title: Pain point focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Get ads from [Competitor] that focus on their messaging about [specific problem]. What pain points are they highlighting and how are they positioning the solution?

prompt_templates.title: Platform comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Get ads from [Competitor] on both Facebook and LinkedIn. Compare how their messaging differs between B2C and B2B audiences.

output_examples.input: Extract ads from Notion on Facebook Ad Library and tell me what messaging is working for them.
output: Notion is running 23 active ads with these primary themes: Productivity (35%), Collaboration (30%), Templates (20%), AI Features (15%)
Top pain points highlighted: Scattered information across tools, Meeting overload, Lost documentation
Best-performing visual pattern: Before/after split showing chaotic tools â†’ clean Notion workspace
Key insight: Short copy under 100 characters with problem-focused headlines performs best
Audience segments: Startup founders (solo productivity), Team leads (collaboration), Enterprise (security/compliance)

best_practices: Extract ads from at least 3 competitors to identify common patterns across your market
Save ads monthly to track how messaging evolves over time with seasonal campaigns and product launches
Focus on the problems competitors emphasize rather than features to find underserved pain points
anti_patterns: Copying competitor ad copy directly instead of using insights to inspire original creative
Only analyzing one competitor instead of mapping the full competitive landscape
Focusing only on ad creative without considering the target audience segment for each message

faq.question: Which ad libraries does this skill support?
faq.answer: Facebook Ad Library and LinkedIn ads. Other platforms with public ad transparency tools may work depending on available tools.

faq.question: How many competitors can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: No hard limit. For comprehensive analysis, 3-5 competitors provides good market coverage without overwhelming comparison.

faq.question: Can I use this with MCP tools for web scraping?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides prompts that work with any web scraping capability. Check your AI tool for available browser or API tools.

faq.question: Is the data safe to use for my own campaigns?
faq.answer: Yes. Use insights for inspiration only. Do not copy ad copy, images, or creative directly to avoid intellectual property issues.

faq.question: Why are some competitor ads missing?
faq.answer: Ad libraries only show ads the platform deems relevant to search. Some ads may not appear based on transparency settings or targeting criteria.

faq.question: How is this different from manual ad library browsing?
faq.answer: This skill systematically extracts and categorizes ads across competitors, identifies patterns that would take hours of manual review to discover.
